name: Muertos Couple 2
description: This print was originally designed for Poster Child Prints. It is slightly larger than it's younger sister, Muertos Couple, and fits nicely into standard frames... silk screened bright white archival paper black / purple / fluorescent pink edition of 100 signed and numbered by Matt Goldman 9" x 12"

name: Party Hat
description:
Party Hat originally designed for MFG's birthday at Dance Right.  It's the partiest of graphics which means if someone gives this to you, you are required to buy them drinks.  Or sodas.  Whatever they enjoy partying with.

silkscreen on bright white archival paper
uncoated black + fluorescent green and pink 
edition of 80
signed and numbered by MFG
9" x 9"

name: Lucha Masks
description: This is the oldest graphic of the series and was designed for the sixth week of Dance Right. When a luchador knocks you out, this is what's flying above your head instead of stars or angels. silkscreen on bright white archival paper uncoated black + fluorescent green and pink edition of 80 signed and numbered by MFG 9" x 9"

name: Dance Right
description:
These dancers were designed were originally illustrated for James Pants's debut at Dance Right.

silkscreen on bright white archival paper
uncoated black + fluorescent green and pink 
edition of 80
signed and numbered by MFG
9" x 9"

name: Muertos Couple
description: The muertos couple were designed for Dance Right's Prom Night in 2006. Taken after Diego Rivera's mural, "Dream of a Sunday Afternoon in Alameda Park" which itself references "La calavera catrina," a woodcut by Jos√© Guadalupe Posada. silkscreen on bright white archival paper uncoated black + fluorescent green and pink edition of 80 signed and numbered by MFG 9" x 6.75"

name: Voodoo
description: silk screened bright white archival paper black / metallic gold / fluorescent orange edition of 100 signed and numbered by Matt Goldman 10" x 10"

name: OBEY x MFG Street Weapons
description: screen printed on cream french speckletone uncoated red, black, and metallic gold signed and numbered by Shepard Fairey and MFG first edition of 300 18" x 24"

name: Do-Over Vol. 3: Great Weekend & Noelle Scaggs 10"
description: Third in a series of The Do-Over's limited-edition 10" singles. 3-D package by Matt Goldman featuring a red and blue acetate to decode the graphics on Side A & B alongside a custom printed inner sleeve and pressed on speckled purple vinyl. Limited to 1,000 copies. Side A: Great Weekend, the mastermind of The Twilite Tone aka Ynot, who produced and performed on Common's first three albums. Side B: dirty disco Grace Jones style track by Noelle Scaggs and produced by acclaimed Danish producer Robin Hannibal. 003a1 - Great Weekend - Let's Do It Again (Over & Over) by DO OVER 003b1 - Noelle Scaggs - Cherry Pie by DO OVER

name: Full Set of Jane's Addiction Secret LA Show Prints
description: Full set of the prints from La Cita, El Cid, and Echoplex. All prints are signed and either numbered or artist proofs; depending on what is available. You will receive the first edition of the La Cita and Echoplex prints and the second edition of the El Cid print. silkscreened on cream french speckletone red, black, and metallic gold signed and numbered by MFG 3 posters / 18" x 24"

name: MFG Coachella Collab Shirt
description: This limited edition t-shirt was commissioned by Coachella for their artist series along side Tim Biskup, Gary Baseman, The Hundreds, EMEK, and more. The shirts were sold onsite and they shipped us a few to make available for our fans! NOTE: there's literally 3 shirts in stock so grab 'em while they're here! 50/50 White Cotton-Poly Blend Silkscreen Neon Pink + Yellow and Black Edition of 300

name: Jane's Addiction Cinco de Mayo SPECIAL EDITION
description: This poster was designed for the Jane's Addiction secret show at Bardot in Hollywood on May 5, 2010. The Cinco de Mayo celebration also unveiled their new bassist: Duff McKagan from Guns 'n' Roses and Velvet Revolver. A total of 50 red/yellow/green gradient posters were printed and signed by Matt Goldman, and a selection of those will be sold here. The posters were only given out to the band and available here! black silkscreen over red/yellow/green gradient silkscreen on glossy weatherproof card stock printed by Colby Poster Printing Company limited edition of 50 22" x 28"

name: Jane's Addiction Cinco de Mayo Show Poster
description: This poster was designed for the Jane's Addiction secret show at Bardot in Hollywood on May 5, 2010. The Cinco de Mayo celebration also unveiled their new bassist: Duff McKagan from Guns 'n' Roses and Velvet Revolver. A total of 250 yellow/black posters were printed, 50 were signed by Matt Goldman, and a selection of those will be sold here. The posters were handed out at the show and are only available here! black silkscreen over fluorescent yellow silkscreen on glossy weatherproof cardstock printed by Colby Poster Printing Company limited edition of 250 22" x 28"

name: Jane's Addiction at La Cita
description: SOLD OUT - but we have two available as part of the full set of Jane's Addiction Secret LA Show Prints HERE This is one of two posters (the other designed by Shepard Fairey) for the first in a series of secret Jane's Addiction shows with the full original lineup which took place at Dance Right at La Cita! Wanting to recall the look of the old Jane's flyers, we've kept the subject matter racy but integrated the look with the Obey color scheme and Dance Right flyer style. Half of the posters were given away at the show and the other half were sold through the Obey website (and sold out in 45 seconds). We retained a few and they're available here for a limited time... THERE'S ONLY TWO IN STOCK... screen printed on cream french speckletone coated red, black, and metallic gold signed and numbered by MFG edition of 400 + limited ap's (artist's proof) 18" x 24"

options.name: Jane's Addiction at La Cita NUMBERED
Jane's Addiction at La Cita ARTIST PROOF

name: Jane's Addiction at Echoplex
description: This the poster for the third show in the series of Jane's Addiction Los Angeles shows with the full original Jane's lineup. The show took place at the Echoplex on February 16, 2009 and is the third in the series of prints designed by MFG. This Limited Edition poster was not distributed at the show and is only available through the Dance Right store and Jane's Addiction. screen printed on cream french speckletone uncoated red, black, and metallic gold signed and numbered by MFG edition of 200 + limited ap's (artist's proof) 18" x 24"

name: Jane's Addiction at El Cid - 2ND EDITION
description: This the poster for the second show in the series of Jane's Addiction Los Angeles shows with the full original Jane's lineup. The show took place at El Cid right at the edge of Hollywood on November 20, 2008 and is the second in the series of prints designed by MFG. The original 1ST Edition of the poster was almost entirely given away at the show with a the few AP's available for sale through our site selling out quickly. As a result, Jane's Addiction printed a second edition of the poster; this time with a matte finish and more over-printing details. Check out the photos to the left... We've also released some APs of the first edition here. screen printed on cream french speckletone uv coated red, black, and metallic gold signed and numbered by MFG edition of 200 + limited ap's (artist's proof) 18" x 24"

name: Jane's Addiction at Lollapalooza
description: This poster was commissioned by Jane's Addiction for their headlining appearance at this year's Lollapalooza Festival at Grant Park in Chicago. The numbered editions available at Lollapalooza sold out completely. A few copies of the original numbered edition are available here at the Dance Right store. The poster was hand printed in Obey Giant Art's printing facilities in a strict edition of 110 plus a handful of artist proofs. hand silkscreened French¬Æ cream speckletone paper uncoated black and metallic copper signed and numbered by MFG edition of 110 18" x 24"

name: Manifest Equality Limited Edition T-Shirt
description: "It's More Fun to Love Than to Hate" This limited edition t-shirt was designed by Matthew Goldman for the Manifest Equality art show in Los Angeles on March 3rd-7th. The show includes a massive collection of primarily Los Angeles-based artists who created work with the theme of equality for the purpose of spreading awareness for issues such as Proposition 8 which blocks gay marriage in California. The profits are being donated to benefit Manifest Equality! American Apparel crew neck Standard White or 50/50 Asphalt Signed and Numbered Silkscreen Red & Black Ink Edition of 150 www.manifestequality.com

name: SPOON EL CID POSTER
description: This limited edition Spoon poster was designed by Matt Goldman for the January 18th secret show at El Cid. Celebrating the release of their seventh album, Transference, Spoon decided to do a pop-up show in a tiny venue for their fans. The posters were only available at the show the night of the event and we're selling the remaining copies here on the Dance Right store. The poster was printed in Obey Giant Art's printing facilities. hand silkscreened French¬Æ cream speckletone paper uncoated black and speckled red ink signed and numbered by MFG edition of 100 18" x 24"

name: DEERHOOF ATP CUSTOM MADE ~ LIMITED EDITION
description: This is the third release in ATP's Custom Made series, where artists submit four songs: something old, something new, something borrowed and something blue. Art and design by LA artist Matt Goldman. Deluxe gatefold double 7" on heavy vinyl Limited edition silkscreen Edition of 100 Fluorescent Orange, Metallic Gold, Black Signed & Numbered by Matt Goldman Comes with 7" Vinyl Records TRACK LISTING: Side A - Something Old The Tears And Music Of Love (Alternate Take) Side B - Something New Makko Shobu (Piano And Vocal Version) Side C - Something Borrowed Rrrrrright (Gremlin [Ben Butler & The Mousepad] Remix) Side D - Something Blue Blue Cash (Full Band Version)

name: DEERHOOF ATP CUSTOM MADE
description: This is the third release in ATP's Custom Made series, where artists submit four songs: something old, something new, something borrowed and something blue. Art and design by LA artist Matt Goldman. Deluxe gatefold double 7" on heavy vinyl Limited to 1000 copies worldwide. Spot color printed in Fluorescent Orange, Metallic Gold, Black Shrink-wrapped TRACK LISTING: Side A - Something Old The Tears And Music Of Love (Alternate Take) Side B - Something New Makko Shobu (Piano And Vocal Version) Side C - Something Borrowed Rrrrrright (Gremlin [Ben Butler & The Mousepad] Remix) Side D - Something Blue Blue Cash (Full Band Version)

name: OBEY x MFG x STEREO (Collab with Shepard Fairey)
description: This is an original commemorative poster designed for the release party of Shepard's new board series with Stereo Skateboard at Dance Right. screen printed on speckletone uncoated black and metallic gold signed and numbered by Shepard Fairey and MFG edition of 300 + limited ap's (artist's proof) 18" x 24"

name: OBEY x MFG x STEREO T-SHIRT
description: This is the original commemorative t-shirt designed by MFG for the release party of Shepard's new board series with Stereo Skateboard at Dance Right. Only a handful were produced by Obey Clothing and released via their website and Obey Giant's website. All the shirt sold out. We unearthed a few and are releasing them here! screen printed on american apparel / obey basic white black and metallic gold limited edition unisex s / m / l Be sure to choose which size you want from the drop menu below.

name: 55DSL x MFG Show Print
description: This series of prints were created partially for a 55DSL sponsored show. The largest of the prints is the commemorative show print that has a graphic originally created for a t-shirt as part of 55DSL's 10.55 artist collab t-shirt series. Only 1,055 shirts were manufactured and once they're sold out, they're gone. We'll have a few for sale here when we get our shipment. silkscreen on bright white archival paper uncoated black + fluorescent green and pink edition of 80 signed and numbered by MFG 18" x 18"

name: Drama Masks
description: The drama masks were originally designed for Lykke Li and Bjorn (of Peter, Bjorn and John) with the assumption that Lykke was the more chipper of the two of them. All assumptions were, however, incorrect. hand screen printed on bright white archival paper uncoated fluorescent green and pink edition of 80 signed and numbered by MFG 9" x 6.75"

name: Jaws
description:
This print was originally design as a collab between MFG and Barracuda Melrose for Swimming with Sharks over the summer of 2008.  The shirts were limited edition and sold at Barracuda.

silkscreen on bright white archival paper
uncoated black + fluorescent green and pink 
edition of 80
signed and numbered by MFG
9" x 9"

name: Explosion
description: This print was originally designed as the first screenprinted Dance Right shirt with Hit + Run. It is an explosion of decorative flyer elements. silkscreen on bright white archival paper uncoated black + fluorescent green and pink edition of 80 signed and numbered by MFG 6.75" x 9"

name: Dance Right Pin Set
description: Set of five 1" randomly selected Dance Right pins from the archive. They look amazing on messenger bags, denim jackets, belt loops (preferably on APC Jeans), and lost at the bottom of oversized handbags full of forgotten makeup and sand. They will last forever.
